reviewText:
Oh wow, this game.
Needles to say it's a fun as hell little platformer that doubles as sorta of a musical where the narrator sings about your adventure as you progress through the game.  So it's like having an invisible bard follow you around.
True it's not in English so you don't get to understand the lyrics but that in no way is a hinderance on the game itself.
In fact you don't even need to know the language to play the game since it does a fine job explaining what buttons do what
in the beginning.
The graphics are pretty good and the art style fits each stage fairly well.  from the greenery of the forest to the cool lighting effects going on in the caves.
The music is probably the best part of this thing.  Each level has a song tailored just for it with lyrics to boot and they fit the atmosphere perfectly for wherever it plays.  Heck it even changes as you progress through the stage to reflect the mood of whatever area you are in.
I guess my only complaint when it comes to the music is that the boss battles don't have accompanying lyrics like the rest of the level.  One thing I guess I could reccomend is just having english subititles if at all possible.  The singers are fine and I can fully get behind having the songs sung in brazilian portuguese. The english subitles would at least allow for an understanding of the lyrics since I understand they are supposed to be funny and would love to see what they are.
All in all this is a solid little platformer and I would definately reccomend.

reviewText:
I really recommend this game!

The idea behind the game is really good. The dinamic vocal singing what happens in the game is something that makes the game much more interesting. Also, the funny lyrics and the nice melody make the soundtrack perfect. And so is the gameplay. It reminds a lot some classic games from the past. The controls are good, they aren't complicated at all. The game is challenging and fun to play, you can expect many hours playing and singing along with the Hero in his journey to save the princess

10/10, would die for a stone thrown by a monkey again

reviewText:
O jogo é bacana, a arte é legal e o áudio maravilhoso. Mas o jogo está em um estado terrível. Extremamente bugado, várias opções e botões não funcionam. Não há uma transição legal das fases, e ele não te deixa salvar nem voltar para o mapa.
O jogo é muito bonito, e o fato de ser Brasileiro e para Brasileiros faz algo muito maravilhoso. Mas está muito bugado ao ponto de estar injogável. Tive que sair durante o jogo e perdi quase meia hora de gameplay, por que não há instrução de salvar e não consigo acessar as opções no menu de start.
O jogo demorou MUITO a ser devensolvivo, e parece que houve uma preocupação maior com a arte, visual e jogabilidade do que com a qualidade do software em si. Há problemas de compatibilidade com o controle do Xbox Também.
Vou pedir refund e compro de novo quando arrumarem os bugs e o jogo ficar mais jogável.

reviewText:
GENIAL!

O game leva você numa aventura do Herói em busca da princesa por todo o reino. Com uma envolvente e super engraçada narrativa cantada pelos Castro Brothers, o jogo se desenrola exatamente como a letra da canção manda e vice-versa. Uma mecânica simples, mas suficientemente divertida, esse game vale cada centavo. Principalmente por ser mais um game brasileiro se destacando no mercado. Pena que não tenha suporte para língua inglesa (pra atingir um público maior). Mas isso não tira o mérito de um excelente jogo. Os desenvolvedores estão de parabéns por terem adotado um estilo conservador de Aventura 2D em Plataforma e ainda assim, em pleno 2016, inovarem dessa maneira.

Recomendo demais!

reviewText:
Very good, I like what the game proposed to do and how it is structured around it.
The game is simple, there is no innovation or nothing to it that will make you feel like it`s a great game. It tells a story and makes fun of the 2d-walk-to-the-right-until-you-find-something type of games.  The best part is the singer and the lyrics, so if you can understand those (brazilian portuguese) the game will certainly be very enjoyable.


Muito bom, gostei da paródia e da forma que o jogo se apresenta e o que ele propõe.
O jogo é simples, quem procura algo super inovador não vai encontrar. A proposta é somente fazer um jogo que conta uma história e tira sarro de jogos da época 2d-andar-para-a-direita-até-chegar-ao-próximo-objetivo. A melhor parte é a música e se você é da época e entende o que a letra quer dizer, fica bem divertido.

reviewText:
I've played the first three stages (9 levels) and I find the gameplay very, very bad.

It's a cool game, the lyrics are quite funny, but the playing experience is not THAT good. The developers didn't polished' the game before publishing it, I've played the beta and many problems of the beta still exists in the final published version. This was very disappointing. Seeing the game not really finished made me lose the hype of playing it.

Also, the game took so long to be published that I really was expecting more care with the details.

- Many screen transitions are missing.
- The lyrics are cool but they turn boring over the time.
- The game mechanics aren't clear (mostly in the map!)
- Some buttons don't work.
- Although the character, monsters and stages are very well designed, the UI is awfully poor (again, the freaking map UI, oh gosh D:).
- Message box from NPCs have a unnecessary long opening and closing transition (when you talk with many NPCs, this gets annoying).
- The beginning of the game is cool but things don't get difficult during the game, which particularly makes me bored.

So, overall it's a nice game - 6/10, but:

1. Bad gameplay
2. Unclear mechanics
3. Poor UI
4. Bugs
5. Long development time

makes it not good enough to be recommended.

ps: Brazillian player

reviewText:
I really wanted to like this game, but unfortunately the traileres were a LIE! The first chapter seems awesome in all of those videos, but starting from the second chapter it's all downhill. The music stops making sense and it really feels like they forgot how to sing! Plus, the gameplay isn't just repetitive but also very punishing. For a game where you do nothing but jump 75% of the time, having a single jump able to instantly kill you (starting at the jungle map) is just unfair (considering you have very limited lives).

My conclusion:
It was a really nice attempt, it was mostly well done and polished, but for a game where the music is the main feature, they really should have put a lot more effort to it.

Not Enough / 10

reviewText:
In short: Bad gameplay; Generic pixel-art graphics; Generic tune and unfunny lyrics.

EDIT: I want to be clear that I am Brazilian as well, so there's no language barrier here that might make me not get the lyrics.

EDIÇÃO: Quero deixar claro que eu sou brasileiro também, então não existe nenhuma barreira por conta de eu supostamente não falar português.

Overall, the gameplay is just a mediocre side scrolling action game with very basic combat, you character walks as fast as a slug, and without dodges. The visuals are okay, I guess, but it's a generic throwback pixel art.

As for the music: The melody is also a generic high fantasy orchestral track, which isn't bad in on iself, but it's nothing that special. The singer actually did pretty good job, and he is the best element of the game by far. The lyrics, though, are so very unfunny it's painful.

I wanted to say that the lyrics tries to poke fun at some of the elements of the game's genre (like going right, jumping 5 meters in the air, floating platforms and so on), but it just falls flat. If you were around 10 years old you might find this funny, but you also wouldn't have the baggage to understand why this might be funny.
